question: In relation to which field, Guatemala passed Decree 900 law?
explanation: In relation to the agriculture field, Guatemala passed Decree 900 law. Decree 900, also known as the Agrarian Reform Law, was a Guatemalan land-reform law passed on June 17, 1952, during the Guatemalan Revolution. The law was introduced by President Jacobo Arbenz Guzman and passed by the Guatemalan Congress. It redistributed unused land greater than 224 acres in area to local peasants, compensating landowners with government bonds.
